revised_title: Adsorption and Surface Electrification of Bubbles in Water
tldr: This study investigates the adsorption of ions on the surface of bubbles in water and how it affects the surface electrification. The authors found that the charge on bubbles is independent of their radius and depends on the rate of absorption. They also discovered that the time required for surface equilibrium is surprisingly long, indicating the weak binding forces between the adsorbed ions and the surface.
